ref: 9021 prauḍha (*pravuḍha -- ) ʻ full of ʼ MBh., ʻ strong, full- grown, skilful ʼ (prauḍhā -- ʻ experienced mistress ʼ) Kāv. 2. prōḍha -- Apte (prōḍham Pāṇ.gaṇa?). 3. *pravuḍḍha -- . [< *prabr̥(ḍ)ḍha -- (cf. páribr̥ḍha -- ʻ strong ʼ ŚBr.: *br̥ḍḍha -- poss. in *buḍḍha -- 2) X právr̥ddha -- and further infl. by non -- Aryan *pravaḍra -- (and vīḷú<-> ʻ firm ʼ RV.?). -- √br̥h1]
Si. puvaḷu ʻ strong, firm, hard, haughty ʼ;
H. pauṛhā ʻ mighty, firm, stiff ʼ.
